intro: Scrophularia marylandica, commonly known as Maryland蓼, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
